intro: Pugionium cristatum, commonly known as the crested spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Pugionium cristatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
